summary: This is a civil complaint filed by 'Jane Doe' against the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein (via executors Darren K. Indyke and Richard D. Kahn) and Ghislaine Maxwell. The plaintiff alleges she was first approached by Epstein and Maxwell at age 13 at a summer camp in Michigan and subsequently subjected to years of sexual abuse, exploitation, and rape by Epstein, facilitated by Maxwell. The complaint details a pattern of grooming, financial control, and abuse across multiple locations, and seeks damages under various legal theories including sexual assault, battery, and intentional infliction of emotional distress.

persons.name: Jane Doe
persons.context: The plaintiff who alleges she was sexually abused by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell from age 13, starting after meeting them at a summer camp in Michigan. She describes years of grooming, exploitation, and rape.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The notorious convicted sex offender and pedophile whose estate is being sued. The complaint alleges he systematically abused the plaintiff and hundreds of other girls, with the assistance of Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Co-defendant alleged to have been Epstein's coconspirator and accomplice who helped groom and supply him with underage girls, including the plaintiff. She is described as acting like an 'older sister' during the grooming process.

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke
persons.context: Sued in his capacity as an appointed executor of the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein. He is also identified as a trustee of 'The 1953 Trust,' the beneficiary of Epstein's will.

persons.name: Richard D. Kahn
persons.context: Sued in his capacity as an appointed executor of the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein. He is also identified as a trustee of 'The 1953 Trust,' the beneficiary of Epstein's will.

persons.name: Donald J. Trump
persons.context: Mentioned as the owner of Mar-a-Lago, where Epstein introduced the 14-year-old plaintiff to him. Epstein made a suggestive comment about the plaintiff to Trump, who smiled and nodded.

persons.name: Carolyn P. Hermon-Percell
persons.context: A Magistrate Judge of the Superior Court of the Virgin Islands who ordered Epstein's will be admitted to probate and authorized Indyke and Kahn to administer the estate.

connections.description: Described as coconspirators in a system of sexual abuse where Maxwell helped supply Epstein with underage girls and facilitated the abuse.
Epstein is alleged to have groomed, sexually assaulted, and raped Jane Doe over a period of several years, starting when she was 13.
Maxwell is alleged to have groomed Jane Doe, acted as an 'older sister' figure, and facilitated Epstein's abuse of her.
Co-executors of the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein and co-trustees of 'The 1953 Trust,' working together to administer the estate.
Epstein introduced the underage plaintiff to Trump at Mar-a-Lago and made a suggestive comment about her to him.
Indyke served as an executor of Epstein's estate, as appointed in Epstein's will.
Kahn served as an executor of Epstein's estate, as appointed in Epstein's will.

events.title: First Meeting at Interlochen Camp
events.description: 13-year-old Jane Doe first met Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell at Interlochen Arts Camp in Michigan. They approached her, probed her background, and Epstein obtained her mother's phone number.

events.title: Introduction to Donald Trump at Mar-a-Lago
events.description: Epstein took the 14-year-old plaintiff to Mar-a-Lago and introduced her to Donald J. Trump, making a suggestive comment about her to Trump.

events.title: First Sexual Assault in Pool House
events.description: Epstein invited Doe into his pool house, grabbed her, put her on his lap, and began masturbating.

events.title: Rape at New York Townhouse
events.description: When Doe was 17, at Epstein's townhouse on 9 East 71st Street in New York City, Epstein pushed her down and raped her after a conversation about boyfriends.

events.title: Epstein Indicted by SDNY
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted by the United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Epstein's Death in Jail
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his jail cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. The medical examiner concluded he died by suicide.

events.title: Execution of Epstein's Will
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein executed his last will and testament at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Epstein's Will Filed for Probate
events.description: Epstein's last will and testament was filed in the Probate Division of the Superior Court of the Virgin Islands.

events.title: Will Admitted to Probate
events.description: Magistrate Judge Carolyn P. Hermon-Percell ordered Epstein's will be admitted to probate and authorized Indyke and Kahn to administer the estate.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York City, NY (Epstein's townhouse)
Apartment on 65th Street and 2nd Avenue, New York City, NY
Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York City, NY
U.S. Virgin Islands (Epstein's domicile at death)
Southern District of New York (court jurisdiction)
keyFacts: The plaintiff, Jane Doe, alleges she was the 'first known victim' of Epstein and Maxwell, whom they used as a 'guinea pig' to refine their criminal enterprise of sexual abuse.

The abuse allegedly began when Doe was 13 after meeting Epstein and Maxwell at a summer arts camp in Michigan and involved grooming, financial control, and escalating sexual assaults culminating in rape.
Epstein introduced the 14-year-old plaintiff to Donald J. Trump at Mar-a-Lago, with Epstein making a suggestive comment about her to Trump.
Abuse occurred at multiple Epstein properties: his Palm Beach mansion, his New York City townhouse at 9 East 71st Street, and his New Mexico ranch.
The complaint is filed under the New York Child Victims Act, which extends the statute of limitations for childhood sexual abuse claims.
